SEARCH
Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.json.mapping.deserialization

Interface ObjectMapper

All Superinterfaces:
Mapper, WritingMapper<ObjectMapper>
public interface ObjectMapper extends WritingMapper<ObjectMapper>
Interface for mapping JSON objects to Java objects.

The ObjectMapper interface defines the contract for converting JSONObject instances and JSONArray instances into Java objects of specified types. It leverages a NameConverter to handle the transformation of field names according to a defined naming strategy (e.g., converting from snake_case to camelCase).

Implementations of this interface are responsible for handling the intricacies of JSON deserialization, ensuring type safety, and managing any necessary conversions or custom mappings between JSON structures and Java object fields. This interface extends WritingMapper, which allows for the inclusion of additional mapping configurations and customizations.

Key Features:

  • Conversion of JSONObject to single Java objects.
  • Conversion of JSONArray to arrays of Java objects.
  • Conversion of JSONArray to collections of Java objects with customizable collection types.
  • Support for custom naming strategies via NameConverter.
  • Handling of complex JSON structures and nested objects.

Example Usage:


 // Instantiate an ObjectMapper implementation
 ObjectMapper mapper = ObjectMapper.newReflectionMapper();

 // Example JSON data
 JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject();
 jsonObject.put("id", 1);
 jsonObject.put("name", "John Doe");

 // Deserialize JSONObject to a Java object
 MyClass myObject = mapper.toObject(jsonObject, MyClass.class);

 // Example JSON array
 JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray();
 jsonArray.add(jsonObject);
 jsonArray.add(jsonObject.clone().put("id", 2).put("name", "Jane Smith"));

 // Deserialize JSONArray to an array of Java objects
 MyClass[] myObjectsArray = mapper.toArray(jsonArray, MyClass[].class);

 // Deserialize JSONArray to a collection of Java objects
 List<MyClass> myObjectsList = mapper.toCollection(jsonArray, MyClass.class, ArrayList::new);

Exception Handling:

  • MappingException: Thrown when an error occurs during the mapping process, such as type mismatches, missing fields, or issues with the deserialization logic.
  • RuntimeException: Thrown for unexpected, critical errors that do not fall under MappingException. These typically include unchecked exceptions that arise from unforeseen issues.

Implementers should ensure that MappingException is thrown for known, recoverable issues related to mapping and deserialization, while reserving RuntimeException for unforeseen, critical errors.

See Also:
  • JSONObject
  • JSONArray
  • NameConverter
  • WritingMapper
  • MappingException

    • newMethodHandleMapper

      static ObjectMapper newMethodHandleMapper()
      Creates a new ObjectMapper instance that utilizes method handles for mapping, employing the default naming converter.
      Returns:
      a new ObjectMapper instance using method handles and the default naming strategy

    • newMethodHandleMapper

      static ObjectMapper newMethodHandleMapper(NameConverter nameConverter)
      Creates a new ObjectMapper instance that utilizes method handles for mapping, with a specified naming converter.
      Parameters:
      nameConverter - the naming strategy to apply to fields
      Returns:
      a new ObjectMapper instance using method handles and the provided naming strategy

    • toObject

      @NotNull @NotNull Object toObject(@NotNull @NotNull JSONObject object, @NotNull @NotNull Type type)
      Converts a JSONObject into an object of the specified Type.
      Parameters:
      object - the JSON object to be deserialized
      type - the target type for deserialization (e.g., new TypeToken<Target<Integer>>() {}.getType())
      Returns:
      the deserialized object
      Throws:
      MappingException - if deserialization fails due to type mismatches, missing fields, or other mapping issues

    • toArray

      @NotNull @NotNull Object[] toArray(@NotNull @NotNull JSONArray array, @NotNull @NotNull Type type)
      Converts a JSONArray into an array of objects of the specified Type.
      Parameters:
      array - the JSON array to be deserialized
      type - the target array type for deserialization (e.g., new TypeToken<Target<Integer>>() {}.getType())
      Returns:
      an array of deserialized objects
      Throws:
      MappingException - if deserialization fails due to type mismatches or other mapping issues
      See Also:
      • TypeToken

    • toObject

      @NotNull <T> T toObject(@NotNull @NotNull JSONObject object, @NotNull @NotNull Class<? extends T> type)
      Converts a JSONObject into object of the specified class.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object to be returned
      Parameters:
      object - the JSON object to be deserialized
      type - the target class for deserialization
      Returns:
      the deserialized object of type T
      Throws:
      MappingException - if deserialization fails due to type mismatches, missing fields, or other mapping issues

    • toArray

      @NotNull <T> T[] toArray(@NotNull @NotNull JSONArray array, @NotNull @NotNull Class<? extends T[]> type)
      Converts a JSONArray into an array of objects of the specified array class.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of objects within the array
      Parameters:
      array - the JSON array to be deserialized
      type - the target array class for deserialization (e.g., Target[].class)
      Returns:
      an array of deserialized objects of type T
      Throws:
      MappingException - if deserialization fails due to type mismatches or other mapping issues

    • toCollection

      @NotNull <E, C extends Collection<E>> C toCollection(@NotNull @NotNull JSONArray array, @NotNull @NotNull Type type, @NotNull @NotNull Supplier<C> supplier)
      Converts a JSONArray into a Java Collection of the specified type, using a provided Supplier to instantiate the collection.
      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements within the collection
      C - the type of the collection to be returned
      Parameters:
      array - the JSON array to be deserialized
      type - the target element type for deserialization. Either it's Class or Type obtained from TypeToken
      supplier - a supplier that provides an instance of the desired collection type
      Returns:
      a collection of deserialized objects of type E
      Throws:
      MappingException - if deserialization fails due to type mismatches or other mapping issues

    • toCollection

      @NotNull <E, C extends Collection<E>> C toCollection(@NotNull @NotNull JSONArray array, @NotNull @NotNull Class<? extends E> type, @NotNull @NotNull Supplier<C> supplier)
      Converts a JSONArray into a Java Collection of the specified type, using a provided Supplier to instantiate the collection.
      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements within the collection.
      C - the type of the collection to be returned
      Parameters:
      array - the JSON array to be deserialized
      type - the raw target element type for deserialization (e.g., Target.class)
      supplier - a supplier that provides an instance of the desired collection type.

      It's recommended that supplier returns a new, empty collection instance (e.g., ArrayList::new)

      Returns:
      a collection of deserialized objects of type E
      Throws:
      MappingException - if deserialization fails due to type mismatches or other mapping issues

    • getInstanceSupplier

      @NotNull @NotNull InstanceSupplier<JSONObject> getInstanceSupplier()
      Retrieves the InstanceSupplier responsible for providing instances from JSONObject. This can be used to customize how instances are supplied from JSONObject during deserialization.
      Returns:
      the InstanceSupplier for JSONObject
